instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.message:
Hi,
i have this imac with only one led1
i find some component broken like R5335, U5420, U9720 (when i remove this last PP5V_S0 in diode mode 0,020 became 0,250)
for the last i can't find the reference REF3333, is not the reference i think.
i would like to find in other board but when i search this ref, i find a lot of board but not this component.
Do you have an idea where can find it?
I think the SSD kill the board or the board kill the SSD, because he don't work.

i try without U9720 but all no PP5V_S0, is it normal?

PP12V_S0_FET pulses at least?
I saw Q7950 leakage issue sometime.

Check if PM_SLP_S4_L pulses when you trigger SMC_ONOFF_L.

no pulse PP12V_S0_FET & PM_SLP_S4_L when i push on the power button
I check the signal SMC_ONOF_L fall down when i push the button.

Now check if PM_PWRBTN_L drops at same tinme.
PM_RSMRST_L must be high.

PM_PWRBTN_L fall down when i push button.
PM_RSMRST_PCH_L stay always high

Then all PM_SLP_Sx_L signals should pulse at same time; if not is PCH issue.
However, check first if PCH gets all (other) signals required for power on sequence.

ok i have no pulse on all PM_SLP_Sx_L. i think it's power sequence problem.
I try to find it this day. i have a question for power supply, can i use a external power supply and apply 12V on the board? without the real supply because it's hard to check signal on the iMac.
thanks

finally i check power sequence like this example

G3H/RTC rails + 32kHz RTC clock → {SRTCRST, RTCRST, INTVRMEN, INTRUDER#, DSWVRMEN} → S5 rails → S5_PWRGD → DPWROK → SLP_SUS# → SUS rails → RSMRST# → BATLOW# → PWRBTN# → SLP_S5# → SLP_S4#

Some signal are not present on this board. all seems good befor SLP_S5 but no PM_SLP_S5_L & PM_SLP_S4_L signal 
maybe a bad U1800? is it possible?

We talk about Apple board, why do you write "#" here?

Trigger  SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

sorry i copy just a start sequence find on a website.
PM_PWRBTN_L fall when i short SMC_ONOFF_L, i tell you on previous message :)

If PCH gets all the signals required, then is bad; if yuo cannot get any pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L.
I recommend you to use an o-scope; it can catch any fast peak pulse.

i use an tektronix tbs 1102B and i don't see anything on PM_SLP_S4_L.
Garbage or try to change U1800 by donor?
thanks
Change PCH, if all RTC signals are good for sure...
